Well, there also is one major problem with League's design compared to Dota's. Abilities scaling with AD, AP and other stats. This leads to very problematic relations between certain champs and items. This leads to huge problems when item balance is changed, leading to several champs being screwed over or others suddenly being broken. Then again you'll change champion balance and suddenly certain items become problematic and need to be nerfed.

Besides the different design philosophy I feel like this makes League balance more problematic. In Dota you have a few more options to change their hero balance. For example: If the Dota balance team feels like a certain ranged champ is too good at kiting and never letting melee heros participate, they could just adjust the character's turn speed and they might already have balanced the hero. The lack of AP and AD scaling also makes it easier to finetune hero abilities without having to fear an item change destroying the whole hero's stat balance.

(Also, if I get first blood from ganking, first drake because I ganked bot, and first tower because I ganked a tp-less/tp-down top lane...

I could probably win nearly every game. Unfortunately, statistics don't work in our favor like that. (You don't get a 70% win rate from first tower because it's first tower. You get a 70% win rate from first tower because your "team" got first tower). If that makes sense? Meaning, the tower itself isn't winning your game, it's the team/players that are making the decisions that lead to that first tower. It's not the decisions themselves, it's the combined process of your entire team and their ability vs that of the enemy team. 

Part of that statistic could be the advantage that the first tower is giving you. It's actually pretty easy to see how little the actual objective matters towards winning when you consider that the massive first blood tower bonus that can lead to a pretty heavy snowball... only increased the win rate from first tower by 3%... (and we're not sure if that's why it's gone up by 3%, that 3% could be influenced by a lot of other factors in the game... but for argument's sake...) The actual effect that first blood tower might have on the game could be a 1% or 2% increase to your chances of winning, but because your team or a player on your team is making the right calls, and should continue to do so most of the time for the rest of the game... you'll continue to secure other advantages around the map, and that's why you end up winning 73% of the time with a first blood tower...

That's a horrible idea. The worst thing you can do as a game designer is make arbitrary rules that prevent people from playing in the optimal way. Instead you motivate people to play healthier by changing the game itself (like the first tower blood). 

It's the same reason when an item is problematic Riot doesn't prevent any one particular champion from buying it. When you start making patchwork rules to plug holes in your game, that's when you know you have failed as a designer. Sometimes these rules can accomplish the same thing, but sticking to a methodology is important so that 5 years down the line you don't have stuff like 

1) no lane swapping before five minutes
2) Each team can have no more than 1 tank
3) Cannot take Courage of the Colossus on Zac
4) No 5 man tower dives
etc... 
It's not so much that banning laneswaps is bad, but the precedent is dangerous.

The Fortification changes are more than enough to make sure noone goes for a laneswap unless he's completely outpicked in standart lanes. With the current fortification, the team that initiates a laneswap needs **TWICE** as long to take the first tower, that's plenty of time for the enemy team to take a free drake, or push the inner tower or even try and defend their own tower.

The there is another imprtant fact: winrate of first tower was ~69-70% befor towerfirstblood already. The S6 vision and towergold changes are on of the main factors for snowballing. With how limited vision is since S6 mapcontroll from other sources like towers has become way more imprtant and impactfull, and the overall increase on towergold means they give your team a sigificant god advantage even without tower FB ontop of the mapcontroll.
